alert.note: Alert for Upper Hood River Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 18 at 8:39PM PST until December 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST SUNDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, wet snow with accumulations of 2 to 6 inches for elevations above 1500 feet. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy wet snow throughout the Upper Hood River Valley with additional snow accumulations of 6 to 18 inches possible. * WHERE...Upper Hood River Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will increase in intensity Sunday night, with snow levels possibly lowering back to valley floor. Snow accumulations are likely throughout the Upper Hood River Valley Sunday night through Monday morning, but exact snow amounts and snow levels remain uncertain. There is also a chance for a brief period of freezing rain Sunday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
